It is iron.  I had thought some Shoami too, but the thickness and weight seems unusual to me.

  From: klepet33319 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Sunday, February 26, 2006 7:37 PM

  Wasn't Iyo primarily non-iron?  My first thought was Iyo also but I 
  thought this was iron and hence probably not Iyo.

  --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Jim Gilbert" <jggilbert@...> 
  wrote:
  >
  > My first thought was Iyo Shoami given the style of work and their 
  fondness for butterfly designs.  The Ikeda family used a similar cho 
  mon.
  > 
  > Jim
  > 
  > 
  > 
  >   My thinking goes toward Shoami, possibly Shonai.  Color of metal, 
  use 
  >   of gold nunome highlighting, and size of seppadai.
